# Contributing to Dynamic Presentation and Auto-Generated Notes

## How to Get Involved

### Get the Code on Your Computer

1. **Fork the Repository**: Click the "Fork" button at the top right of this page. This makes a copy of the code that you can edit.

2. **Download the Code**: On your computer, open a terminal and run:

    ```
    git clone https://github.com/your-username/project-name.git
    ```

### Make Your Changes

1. **Create a New Branch**: Before making any changes, it's a good practice to create a new branch. This keeps your changes organized.

    ```
    git checkout -b name-of-your-new-branch
    ```

2. **Make Changes**: Now you can start adding to or editing the project code. Make sure you save your changes!

### Share Your Changes

1. **Commit Your Changes**: Once you're done making changes, you can save them.

    ```
    git add .
    git commit -m "Describe your changes here"
    ```

2. **Upload (Push) Your Changes**: Upload your saved changes to GitHub.

    ```
    git push origin name-of-your-new-branch
    ```

3. **Open a Pull Request**: Go back to your repository on GitHub and click the "New Pull Request" button. Follow the prompts to submit your changes for review.
